intro: Notylia apiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broomrape, is a parasitic plant that lacks chlorophyll and cannot perform photosynthesis. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is found in various regions of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. The plant typically grows on the roots of other plants, drawing nutrients from its host. Its flowers are small and pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. Notylia apiculata is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique parasitic lifestyle and ecological interactions.
